summary: Email correspondence between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York discussing the preparation of a memo about the Epstein investigation. The emails reference an 86-page memo that canvasses the full scope of the investigation, including topics such as the number of victims interviewed, charges, foreign victims, and the status of the investigation.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email requesting a blurb on the Epstein case for inclusion in a memo, to highlight the work of the investigation team.

events.title: Meeting about Epstein investigation memo
events.description: A meeting was held with unspecified individuals and 'the brass' about an 86-page memo submitted canvassing the full scope of the Epstein investigation and related topics.

locations.name: Southern District of New York
locations.context: Jurisdiction of the prosecutors involved in the correspondence.

locations.name: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
locations.context: Address provided for the Assistant United States Attorney's office.

keyFacts: An 86-page memo was submitted canvassing the full scope of the Epstein investigation and other related topics.
Prosecutors met with 'the brass' to discuss this comprehensive memo on January 9, 2020.
A request was made for a concise summary ('blurb') of the Epstein case including the number of victims interviewed, charges, any foreign victims, resolution, and current investigation status.
The correspondence indicates the complexity of the case, described as 'sort of impossible to briefly summarize in a blurb'.
The purpose of the requested blurb was to include the case in a memo to highlight the investigative team's work.
